div.l: Alas qduod John Alayn for cristes peyne
Lay don þi swird and I wil myn Also
I am ful swift god wote as a ro
By goddis hert he shal scape vs boþe
Whi ne hadde þow put þe capel in þe lathe
Il hail by god Aleyn þow is fonne
These sely clerkys han ful fast I ronne
Toward þe fen bothe Aleyn ⁊and eke John
And when þe Miller seigh þat þei were gon
He half a busshel of her floure hath take
And bade his wif go knede it in in a kake
And seide I trow þe clerkys were a ferde
Ȝet con a Meller make a clerkes berd
For alle his art ȝet let hem gon her way
Lo where he goth ȝe let þe childre play
Þei gete hym nouȝt so lightly by my croune
These sely clerkys rennen vp ⁊and down
Wit kepe kepe stand stand iossa warderere
Go whistil þow and I chalhalchal kepe hym here
div.note: Correction may be a later hand.
div.l: But shortly til it was verey nyght
Þei kouth nouȝt þouȝ þei did al her myght
Hire caple cache he ran al with so fast
Til in a dyche þei caught hym atte last
Werey and wete as best is in þe rayne
Comyth sely John and with hym comyth aleyn
Alas qduod Iohan þe day þat I was borne
Nowe ere we dryuen til hethyng ⁊and til scorn
Oure corn is stole men wil vs foles calle
Bothe þe wardeyn and oure felowes alle
And namely þe Meller weylawey
Thus pleyneth John as he goth be þe wey
Toward þe Mille and bayard in his hond
Þe Miller syttyng by þe fire he fond
For it was nyȝt ⁊and forther myght he nouȝt
But for þe loue of god þei hym by souȝt
Of Herberew and of Ese and for her peny
The Miller said a gayn if þer be eny
Swiche as it is ȝet shal ȝe have ȝour part
